page.title: 15THE QUARRY
page.content: The Quarry was originally a sandstone quarry working in 1786. The church and school were built from stone quarried here. It became a dump after all the stone was taken out. Water collected in the pit and trees and wildlife had grown up around. There was a little workshop there which made ladders, then it became a cycle and motorbike repair shop. When it closed down all of the stuff was dumped in the Quarry. The site was owned by the Scotney Estate, but in 1977 (Jubilee year) a management committee cleared the trees to make open space and removed the rubbish from the pond. Many fish live in the pond and now there is an angling club. The open spaces now serve as a picnic area for visitors.
